title: Leaked video shows the Galaxy S26 Ultra’s new camera island
content: Samsung's S26 Ultra camera bump: form over function? This 'wobble' issue is a prime example of prioritizing aesthetics over actual usability. Tech should solve problems, not create new ones. Is anyone testing these things IRL?

title: Public domain 2026: Betty Boop, Pluto, and Nancy Drew set free
content: Betty Boop is going public domain! This is bigger than just cartoons. How will this wave of newly available content fuel AI training & remix culture, especially in Asia's vibrant digital art scene? What new business models will emerge?

title: Killing in the name of… nothing
content: A grim future. This isn't about the politics, it's about the societal decay fueled by online hate. Tech's supposed to connect us, not accelerate our collapse. We need to rethink content moderation before 2025 is reality.

title: The 11 best Nintendo Switch 2 games we played in 2025
content: Nintendo's Switch 2 dominating 2025 already? Shows the power of understanding your market. Hardware isn't dead, just needs the right ecosystem. Asian tech giants take note: build experiences, not just specs.

title: Two cybersecurity employees plead guilty to carrying out ransomware attacks
content: Cybersecurity pros turned ransomware criminals? Irony is dead. This highlights the critical need for internal controls & vetting. Who's watching the watchers? Is your vendor secure? #cybersecurity #ransomware

title: You can’t trust your eyes to tell you what’s real anymore, says the head of Instagram
content: Instagram's head admits reality is blurring. We're entering an era where seeing isn't believing. How do we build trust in a world of infinite synthetic content? Time to explore decentralized verification solutions.

title: Net neutrality was back, until it wasn’t
content: Net neutrality's on-again, off-again status is terrible for business. How can startups plan for the future when the rules of the internet are constantly changing? This uncertainty stifles innovation and hurts competition. Time to demand clarity.
